ygData.subject: Re: AC vs Stat enhancing armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Preach on Sister Bree. My team is the same way and we are only lvl 24ish.(got 24 for the 3rd or 4th time last night... when I got booted I still had it so I am
ygData.messageBody:
Preach on Sister Bree.

My team is the same way and we are only lvl 24ish.(got 24 for the 3rd or 4th
time last night... when I got booted I still had it so I am happy).

My guys I team with normally will ignore whatever we are attacking (no
matter now many or what) to get the other stuff off of me... then they will
go back to the big baddie. Very nice. lets me do my job easier let me tell
ya.

Jaxim



>From: "Heather Daley" <blushn@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] AC vs Stat enhancing armor
>Date: Tue, 24 Aug 1999 17:49:10 EDT
>
>From: "Heather Daley" <blushn@...>
>
>I would definitely go with the stat increasing items. In my experiences
>with the game, this is what I have found. A cleric will never be a tank
>and
>yes you will get hit, Mobs tend to dislike clerics when they heal, do DD or
>Stun, so AC is a good thing to have but Mana is king for a cleric, In my
>opinion. AC will in no way, shape or form save your life.
>
>It is an absolute necessity to have good tanks and for you to trust your
>tanks, granted this takes time to get really comfortable with a good group
>of people.
>
>Basically what i'm saying is while AC is good, you should not be getting
>hit. When you do get hit, your tanks are obligated to taunt the beast off
>of you, no matter how many mobs you are fighting. This is the way it works
>in the group I hunt with. My group is always the same with minor
>alterations
>to one position, it is an advantage having a group that is with each other
>all the time, you come to learn how each one will react in certain
>situations.
>
>we have in our standard group:
>Paladin, Ranger, Warrior, Wizard, Enchanter, and me the Cleric.
>the Tanks( pal, rng, war)are very attentive to when a mob starts to hit a
>caster or me, so the more wisdom I have the more I can effectively do my
>job
>as it was intended which is healing.
>
>I even gave up my Azure sleeves ( 12ac) for Platinum armbands ( no AC, but
>3
>wis) lol, never can have to much wisdom.
>
>Just my opinion,
>
>Bree Wyndsdale
>45th Cleric of Fennin Ro
>
>
>>From: "Rose" <rliu@...>
>>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>>To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>>Subject: [EQ-Clerics] AC vs Stat enhancing armor
>>Date: Tue, 24 Aug 1999 11:42:34 -0500
>>
>>From: "Rose" <rliu@...>
>>
>>Hail all,
>>
>>This question most likely has been asked already and I apologize if I'm
>>repeating but I am new to the list and rather new to casting class in
>>general.
>>
>>My question is, which is better, pure AC or stat enchancing armor? I was
>>thinking of covering myself fully in bronze plate but there are things
>>like
>>BS tunic, barb arms, silver plated bracers that I will be putting aside.
>>I
>>am playing mostly a casting cleric...and I figured AC would save my life
>>more then any stat enhancing armor. Any thoughts?
>>
>>-Imogen
>>
>>
